entry.title: Allow urlPattern field to take URLPatternInit.
entry.content:
This is something told in:

https://github.com/yoshisatoyanagisawa/service-worker-static-routing-api/blob/main/final-form.md



To allow people to write a complex pattern and make URLPattern

understand it, let me make URLPatternInit also supported.

With this way, people can write like:



condition: {

urlPattern: new URLPattern("*://example.com/*.ico")

}



With this change, we also changed the string URLPattern behavior.

It used to be thought as the pathname URL pattern.

i.e. equivalent behavior to:

URLPattern({pathname: ""}).

However, now it silently sets the ServiceWorker script's base URL

as the base URL.

i.e. URLPattern({pathname: ""},

entry.title: [win] Replace GetChromeInstallPath with simpler primitives
entry.content:
GetChromeInstallPath returned the path to a currently-installed Chrome

or, if one was not found, the default install path. Many of its callers

only care about the path to an existing install, and don't want the path

if Chrome isn't installed. In this CL, we split GetChromeInstallPath

into GetInstalledDirectory, which returns a path to an existing

installation or an empty path, and GetDefaultChromeInstallPath, which

returns the default path and CHECKs if this is not possible.



This CL also simplifies the logic in CanUpdateCurrentChrome. Previously,

it would compare the current browser's install directory to the current

or default install directory for both per-user and per-machine

installs. Since Google Update will only update one or the other, it

suffices to only check against the currently-installed browser at the

current level (per-user or per-machine).



In combination, these changes should resove two potential crashes:



1. CanUpdateCurrentChrome could have crashed when looking for the

"other" install level's directory. For example, if the PathService

cannot resolve DIR_PROGRAM_FILES and the PROGRAMFILES environment

variable is not set.



2. CheckMachineLevelInstall could have crashed when looking for a

per-user install's directory if there was no per-user install and the

PathService couldn't resolve DIR_LOCAL_APP_DATA and the LOCALAPPDATA

environment variable was not set.



Bug: 1467740

Change-Id: I65acfe547dcc8045edb1fa7e187aed003d8f2848

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4732972

Reviewed-by: Vasilii Sukhanov

Reviewed-by: Peter Kasting

entry.title: [iOS] Rename dismissClearBrowsingData
entry.content:
The method name seemed to indicate that the only result was to dismiss

the CBD. Actually, this method is called when the user press "Done",

and the result is always to dismiss the all settings navigation

controller. The new name reflect this behavior.



Also, as a delegate method, it should take the caller as parameter.

entry.title: Prerender: Separate the number limit of speculation rules by eagerness
entry.content:
Before this CL, PrerenderHostRegistry had a limit on the maximum number

of running prerenders for embedder and speculation rules, respectively.



This CL further separates the number limit of speculation rules into

following two categories by eagerness:

- Eager(eager), which are triggered immediately after adding the rule.

- Non-eager(moderate, conservative), which wait for a specific user

action to trigger.

and applies the appropriate corresponding limits per these

attributes(currently sets to 10 and 2, respectively).



Please see the design doc on crbug for more information.



Bug: 1464021

Change-Id: I9b78b379eec33f4392d75aedba6f37aa1742126e

entry.title: Revert "bluetooth: Always include bonded devices in UI"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 014c273fb7917159c92196e574c85d4955ea089b.



Reason for revert: b/293949690, breaks browser_tests --gtest_filter="DeviceEventLogErrorBrowserTest.LoginUser"



Original change's description:

> bluetooth: Always include bonded devices in UI

>

> This change updates the logic that determines whether a Bluetooth device

> is supported to automatically treat bonded devics as supported,

> regardless of whether the type of the device would have been supported

> had it not been bonded.

entry.title: Return PiP to original position after notification dismissal
entry.content:
Picture in Picture windows are moved aside if a new popup

notificatin window shows up in a space that overlaps the PiP

window. However, the PiP window did not return to its original

position even after the popup notification window was dismissed

and destroyed.



This commit fixes four issues with the code to properly return

the PiP window position to its original position after the popup

notification window is dismissed.



1. Upon popup notification window destruction, no execution path

that went to WindowState::UpdatePipBounds existed. Now,

WorkspaceLayoutManager calls NotifySystemUiAreaChanged when

OnWindowDestroying is called for the popup notifacion window,

recalculating and updating the PiP window bounds.



2. Bounds calculations are done in CollisionDetectionUtils, which

did not take into account whether a window is under destruction.

This resulted in an incorrect bounds calculation when called from

OnWindowDestroying since the destroyed window still existed. This

also has been updated.



3. During shutdown the pointer for CaptureModeController is

destroyed before the windows are destroyed with

OnWindowDestroying. This is a required behaviour, but with this

calling NotifySystemUiAreaChanged in OnWindowDestroying results in

a crash. Now, it has been updated so that FloatingWindowObserver

is destroyed upon OnShellDestroying, making sure that

OnWindowDestroying is not called during shutdown.



4. SnapFraction, which dictates the position of the PiP window,

was not set when a new PiP window was created. Now, this value is

set when OnWindowVisibilityChanged is called, which ensures that

this value is set when the PiP window is first created.

OnWindowVisibilityChanged was used instead of OnPostPipStateChange

because when OnPostPipStateChange is called the PiP bounds are not

yet set.



Bug: b/286602636

Test: Manually verified that the PiP returns to original position

Change-Id: Iefb505f00ef465932e4c821f85c8b4e05c40246b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4713908

Commit-Queue: Masayuki Fujita

Reviewed-by: Sammie Quon

Auto-Submit: Masayuki Fujita

entry.title: Fix DriveUploadHandlerTest test flakes
entry.content:
NetworkChangeNotifier always sends CONNECTION_NONE before the it sends

an online state; this can race with the test code at the start of the

test, causing the Drive upload operation to fail. Setting the notifier

to send test notifications only prevents this CONNECTION_NONE state

from being sent, which should prevent this race.



Bug: 1468492, b:275977911

entry.title: graphite: Specify BGRA explicitly for OffscreenCanvas WebGL
entry.content:
OffscreenCanvas disables the use of IOSurface backed GMB for WebGL

DrawingBuffer, but with Graphite IOSurfaces are used without GMB or

scanout usage since that's the only way to share textures between WebGL

on ANGLE and Graphite on Dawn.



The RGBA vs BGRA distinction matters for Graphite, so we explicitly use

BGRA on the GMB path, but we're still allowing RGBA on the non-GMB

path. The OS compositor doesn't like RGBA IOSurfaces so we should

explicitly use BGRA in the non-GMB path too. This CL does that by moving

the RGBA to BGRA override outside the ShouldUseImageChromium() branch.



Bug: 1466806

Change-Id: I33fff4c65ea23784155af39481e1e5f95fb15e1b

entry.title: Fix coordinate transforms and clean up menu_controller_unittest.cc.
entry.content:
MenuController event handlers expect the coordinates of provided events

to be in the scroll view container coordinate system (a.k.a. the submenu

root view). Some tests complied with this, others did not. Fix all of

them to be the same.



One test was also failing on Win 11 (and, soon, on other platforms)

because using bubble menus with corner radii resulted in exceeding the

hardcoded size reserved for the menu. Configure this dynamically

instead.



This finally cleans up various other things, e.g. lack of

make_unique<>(), type repetition, etc.



Bug: 1286137

entry.title: WebUI: Simplify the names and classes of c/b/r/extensions tests.
entry.content:
Now that extensions_browsertest.cc is no longer auto-generated by

js2gtest, a simpler naming pattern can be used that does not require

each test case to use a different C++ class.



Example renames:

- CrExtensionsActivityLogTest.All -> CrExtensionsTest.ActivityLog

- CrExtensionsToggleRowTest.All -> CrExtensionsTest.ToggleRow

- CrExtensionsSitePermissionsTest.All

-> CrExtensionsTest.SitePermissions



Where the meaningless "*.All" naming pattern is now unnecessary.

entry.title: Reland "[LCPP] Store LCP element locator in database via mojo"
entry.content:
This CL is a relanding CL of https://crrev.com/c/4672487.



The lifecycle of LCPCriticalPathPredictorHost (browser side) is the same

as the lifecycle of Document (DocumentService managed the lifetime). On

the other hand, the lifecycle of LCPCriticalPathPredictor (renderer

side) is the same as the lifecycle of LocalFrame.



Hence for the first navigation, LCPCriticalPathPredictor could

successfully send lcp_element, but the subsequent navigation that use

the same RenderFrameHost couldn't send lcp_element because host_ is

already disconnected (but still bound) after the first document is

deleted on the same RenderFrameHost.



1. LCPCriticalPathPredictor --bound to--> LCPCriticalPathPredictorHost

2. LCPCriticalPathPredictorHost will be deleted when Document is

deleted.

3. LCPCriticalPathPredictor will lose connection to

LCPCriticalPathPredictorHost (but still bound).



This CL fixes this bug by checking host_.is_connected(), and

reconnecting host.



```

if (!host_.is_bound() || !host_.is_connected()) {

host_.reset();

```



Original change's description:

> Revert "[LCPP] Store LCP element locator in database via mojo"

>

> This reverts commit cf4361574a68b5e67aeac94945ad873c508bc04e.

>

> Reason for revert: Consistently failing on linux-bfcache-rel.

>

> Sample failure:

> https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-bfcache-rel/49473

>

> Original change's description:

> > [LCPP] Store LCP element locator in database via mojo

> >

> > This CL stores LCP element locator information in the

> > database. Specifically, this CL does the following things:

> >

> > - Send LCP element locator candidates from renderer to browser via mojo

> > (LCPCriticalPathPredictor and LCPCriticalPathPredictorHost do this).

> >

> > - Send LCP element locator candidates to

> > LcpCriticalPathPredictorPageLoadMetricsObserver.

> >

> > - The latest LCP element locator will be kept in

> > LcpCriticalPathPredictorPageLoadMetricsObserver.

> >

> > - Save the latest LCP element locator in the database on complete.

> >

> > - Provides PredictLcpElementLocators() for prediction. (This is needed

> > for test.)

> >

> > To send the LCP element locator from LCPCriticalPathPredictorHost to

> > LcpCriticalPathPredictorPageLoadMetricsObserver, this CL uses the

> > PageUserData.

> >

> > https://docs.google.com/document/d/1waakt6bSvedWdaUQ2mC255NF4k8j7LybK2dQ7WptxiE

> >

> > Bug: 1419756

> > Change-Id: Ie14ae5be298c15bed23f69d2fe49fc1ad03868a9

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4672487

entry.title: [A11y] Don't invalidate children/properties while tree is frozen for serialization
entry.content:
Invalidating properties during serialization could lead to restructuring the tree because of changes to ignored/included states. This CL ensures that does not happen, so that during serialization the tree remains stable.

entry.title: Change BrowserColorVariant used for GM2 colors
entry.content:
Changed the BrowserColorVariant for GM2 colors to kSystem instead

of kTonalSpot, since kSystem is the value the pref will have in GM2.

That way the theme's current variant and the GM2 color variant will

properly match in the ts checks. It is also more truthful to use the

default one for GM2 colors since they won't use kTonalSpot.

entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 07d152c515f0d1de66fc7508a09bc789f20afc84

Fixed Fuchsia bots by removing the include that caused the failure,

since it is already included below with

a // NOGNCHECK.



Original change's description:

> Adds OCRed pages to a PDF in batches of 20 each

>

> In order to avoid lockups when OCRing a large PDF, we perform

> OCR on 20 pages at a time and add each batch to the PDF's

> accessibility tree individually.

> An upcoming patch will improve the code that unserializes each patch

> and add a status node to inform the user of this patching.

>

> One-pager at:

> https://docs.google.com/document/d/19DrOBL7rg-4uCi3mA3xB6GlDx7hFKrwpVjqEZ2PUoCg/edit?usp=sharing

>

> R=rhalavati@chromium.org, kyungjunlee@google.com

>

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Homogenize resolution change handling
entry.content:
ToT V4L2StatefulVD only handles the very first resolution change; it

uses it to configure the |CAPTURE_queue_| in cooperation with

VideoDecoderPipeline (via PickDecoderOutputFormat() call).



This CL modifies the code so that this first resolution change event

and any hypothetical later ones are handled in a similar way and in the

event handling function (thus renamed to WaitOnceForEvents()). Note

how it wires the |resolution_change_callback| to a |client_|s method,

which pings back V4L2StatefulVD::ApplyResolutionChange() when ready.



This was tested on trogdor using the vp80-03-segmentation-1425.ivf

sequence, which is composed of: 1KF+3PF of 176x160 , then 1KF+4PF of

224x192 and finally 1KF+4PF of 288x256 pixels of resolution. (KF

stands for Key-frame and PF for Prediction-frame in a mishmash of

terminologies, see [1] if interested). Said sequence decodes and

validates md5sum most of the times: this is because ToT doesn't yet

have a way to handle the situation of no free OUTPUT queue buffers.



[1] https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6386#section-3



Bug: b:279980150

Change-Id: I00e35684a2a6d9bc6f653a6df9d7ac45bc4e7293

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4730153

Reviewed-by: Hang Nguyen

Commit-Queue: Miguel Casas-Sanchez

entry.title: Manually roll nearby-connections from 5b605b242677 to 4a100435f79b
entry.content:
With the introduction of cl/551081080, ResultCallback was changed to be

AnyInvocable. Unit tests needed to be appropriately updated to

accommodate this change.



30 Revisions:

https://chromium.googlesource.com/external/github.com/google/nearby-connections.git/+log/5b605b242677..4a100435f79b



2023-07-31 hais@google.com Apply result code to BLE L2CAP mediums

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 552347968

>



2023-07-29 qinwangz@google.com Retroactive pairing detector: check login status and if device has already been saved to the user's account

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 551985769

>



2023-07-28 jsobczak@google.com Add FinishRetroactivePairing

> Add the second step of retroactive pairing.

> The client should:

> * start retroactive pairing

> * get user consent

> * finish retroactive pairing

>

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 551934024

>



2023-07-28 bourdakos@google.com Add initial BLEv2 Bluetooth Adapter

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 551922301

>



2023-07-28 jsobczak@google.com Use endpoint lost alarms on PCP handler thread only

> endpoint_lost_by_medium_alarms_ should be accessed only

> on PCP handler thread to avoid race conditions.

> Added thread annotations to protect against accidental use on a different thread.

> Test only change.

>

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 551919704

>



2023-07-28 guogang@google.com Fixed some issues in analytics data

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 551900985

>



2023-07-28 guogang@google.com Fixed WI-FI hotspot stuck issue during close

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 551703821

>



2023-07-27 bourdakos@google.com Make `GNCBLEGATTServer` thread safe

> Fixes an issue where if a characteristic is created and then updated with a non-nil value, and a new characteristic under the same service is added, then when the service is re-added the old characteristic will be permanently cached and the dynamic reads will stop working.

>

> This also eliminates the issue when characteristics are created concurrently, since service additions are batched, if the service addition fails then only one of the characteristics will know that it failed to get added.

>

> This change also introduces the nuance of "success" does not mean the CoreBluetooth method has completed successfully, but instead means that the intended state has been recorded and the class will do its best to maintain that state. For example, a successful "start advertising" call means that we have the advertisement cached and we will start advertising as soon as we can (like BT transitions from off to on) and will do our best to keep advertising (like BT transitions from on to off to on again).

>

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 551660634

>



2023-07-27 jsobczak@google.com Skip SDP check for FP rfcomm connection on Windows

> The SDP checks fails but rfcomm connection works.

> Skipping the SDP check does not seem to have any ill side effects.

>

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 551370531

>



2023-07-27 jsobczak@google.com Fix race condition in ThroughputRecorder

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 551361687

>



2023-07-27 jsobczak@google.com Add StopDiscovery call

> Test only change.

>

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 551358525

>



2023-07-26 jsobczak@google.com Destroy ThroughputRecorder when PendingPayload is destroyed

> This fixes a race condition where a Tp Recorder was used after being destroyed.

>

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 551350023

>



2023-07-26 jsobczak@google.com Close executors in BasePcpHandler::Shutdown

> The client can call DisconnectFromEndpointManager() explicitly before

> BasePcpHandler is shut down. In this case, th executors were not terminated

> inside BasePcpHandler::Shutdown()

> This caused use-after-free errors in BasePcpHandlerTest.IoError_RequestConnectionFails

>

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 551340708

>



2023-07-26 bourdakos@google.com Move Server Socket and its dependencies to their own files

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 551330682

>



2023-07-26 qinwangz@google.com Fix flaky test:scanner_broker_impl_test

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 551329018

>



2023-07-26 qinwangz@google.com Integrate Dart UX with windows_admin_plugin

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 551316220

>



2023-07-26 thomasvl@google.com Don't compile `utils.mm` twice.

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 551315072

>



2023-07-26 hais@google.com internal clean up

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 551292810

>



2023-07-26 hais@google.com update sensor fusion api to favor std::optional over absl::optional

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 551257674

>



2023-07-26 awadhera@google.com make ResultCallback a bare function type and convert to AnyInvocable

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 551081080

>



2023-07-26 bourdakos@google.com Extract BLE code into its own target

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 551074383

>



2023-07-26 awadhera@google.com introduce v3 discovery options

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 551053578

2023-07-26 awadhera@google.com introduce v3 advertising options

2023-07-26 jsobczak@google.com Set expected latch before sending messages

> This closes a time window where the sent message was received before the latch was

> configured.

>

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 551050923

>



2023-07-26 qinwangz@google.com Checks if a device is already saved before writing accountkey

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 551045458

>



2023-07-26 jsobczak@google.com Fix minor defects

> Fixes use-after-free and NPE errors.

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 551042892

2023-07-25 qinwangz@google.com Check account log in status before attempt to write account key

2023-07-25 qinwangz@google.com Add UX to show pairing result

2023-07-25 jsobczak@google.com Protect PendingPayload from use-after-free errors.

entry.title: [telemetry] Trim wprgo file to clean up benchmark story
entry.content:
During the recording of the pspdfkit benchmark somehow the first load

always resulted in a failed load, status code 500. A second navigation

to the URL succeeded though. The problem was, as the first load was in

the wprgo file, also the replay story had the first failed load.



This CL trimmed the wprgo file and deleted all entries with status code

500 responses with the command



go run src/httparchive.go trim --status_code=500 $ARCHIVE_IN $ARCHIVE_OUT



The allows the replay story to not contain the second navigation, which

made test results flaky and also caused other issues, see the referenced

issue.



R=johnchen@chromium.org

CC=alexrudenko@chromium.org, clemensb@chromium.org

entry.title: [GridNG] Allow grid sets to be rebuilt on demand by nested subgrids
entry.content:
1. Grid sets are normalized depending on whether the available size of a

grid is definite or not. E.g., percentage tracks were normalized to

behave as 'auto' if their available size was indefinite.



This normalization only occurred during the `InitializeTrackSizes`

step of the sizing algorithm. However, this proved to be insufficient

since, after resolving the columns of the parent grid, the normalized

tracks of a nested subgrid were not updated to behave as percentages.



2. Adding test coverage to the WPT suite for this issue.

entry.title: [text-wrap-pretty] Fix use-counter when failed early
entry.content:
The applicability of the `NGScoreLineBreaker` is determined in

two steps; first by `PrepareLayout`, then by actually trying

to break in `NGScoreLineBreaker`.



The use-counters for when `NGScoreLineBreaker` is not

applicable are counted for the second case but not for the

first case. This patch counts them for the first case as well.

entry.content:
This CL adds a draft of the allow / block content setting UI for

AutoPiP windows. It doesn't try to match any UI mocks; it just adds

some scaffolding to use while we build out the functionality and the

UI itself.



Right now, it's triggered for any document PiP window if blink

feature that corresponds to AutoPiP is enabled, even for pip windows

that aren't opened because of AutoPiP. Video PiP windows are never

affected, though that will be added in the future.

entry.title: Disable ML inliner for Cronet builders that use Mainline Clang
entry.content:
MLGO inliner requires Clang to be built with specific flags. Cronet builders use prebuilt Mainline Clang which does not compile with these flags. Therefore, we have to disable ML inliner for Cronet builders.



Test:

Setting GN args with use_ml_inliner = false:

~/chromium/src$ autoninja -C out/Release net_unittests__library

ninja: Entering directory `out/Release'

[96/96] SOLINK ./libnet_unittests__library.so



Setting GN args with use_ml_inliner = true:

~/chromium/src$ autoninja -C out/Release net_unittests__library

error: Could not setup Inlining Advisor for the requested mode and/or options



Bug: 1468680, 1463752

entry.title: [A11y] Do less work after force loading inline text boxes on Android
entry.content:
1. Only mark the text parent objects as needing to be serialized.

2. Mark them dirty immediately -- not need to wait for another clean layout since layout will already be clean

3. Do not recompute cached values for the text parent objects

4. Do not mark the text parent objects as needing to update children, since they already updating the children

5. Refactor a bit of the CanHaveInlineTextObjects() code to be cleaner



This helps land downstream

CL:4544997, where we enforce that cached values are not invalidated at a bad time.

entry.title: [2.5/3] Refactor OverlayCandidateFactory for delegated overlays
entry.content:
Change 2.5/3 to implement 2d transform delegation.

(dependency for change 3, doesn't depend on change 2)



This refactor simplifies the code for supporting delegating affine

transforms.



Changes:

- Apply content clipping earlier during processing. It's necessary in

all delegated cases, and needs to be done before expanding bounds

- Set display_rect to expanded filter bounds during overlay processing

- Account for this in SkiaRenderer

- This is needed to determine if quad is within bounds, and can have

- clip delegated.

- Handle empty clip_rect case earlier

entry.title: gpu: Remove keyed mutex from DCLayerOverlayImage
entry.content:
The keyed mutex in DCLayerOverlayImage was only used for DXVA decoder

shared images which performed synchronization externally instead of

using representations, scoped access, etc. Since DXVA decoder and its

GLImages are gone, this is dead code now.

entry.title: [Privacy Sandbox] Add console log for attestations failures
entry.content:
Log a console error upon attestation check failure, as a convenience

feature for developers.



Two cases that don't get console logs:

* Private Aggregation is asynchronous enough that it doesn't have a

relevant RenderFrameHost for its worklet, so there is no console log.

* Reporting destination checks have console logs higher in the stack

(because the checks are narrowly scoped attestation checks, rather

than overall permissions checks), so it would be redundant to log

again inside them.



There is test coverage for APIs that already have end-to-end attestation

tests set up (i.e. all of them except Protected Audience).



Bug: 1458554

entry.title: [android] External Selection Action Menu Callback Fix
entry.content:
Returning true onClick() for a MenuItem with a custom OnClickListener

was causing the external ActionMode click handling callbacks to not be

called. This regression (introduced in CL#4547564) has now been fixed.



A refactor for the custom click listeners has also been added so that

the sequencing of events is as it was before the regression. Meaning

that if an external action mode callback handles a menu item click, any

click handling inside of SelectioPopupControllerImpl or

FloatingPastePopupMenu is skipped.



The next CL in this stack will fix this for the drop-down menu.



Bug: 1466326

Change-Id: I2ce57e7e2e640bd3e2f0799927cd6900045fec8e

Reviewed-by: David Trainor

entry.title: Clean Up Favicon Fetcher
entry.content:
The purpose of this change is to Consolidate logic retrieving and

generating Suggestion decorations, preparing it to handle broader

set of tasks (including retrieval of images from the web).



Summary of changes:

1. Backoff mechanism is removed

- LargeIconBridge caches return values for URLs, so backoff

is no longer effective.

- LargeIconBridge fixed issues with low-res icons being offered when

min icon size was lower than desired icon size.

2. Favicon Type Cache is removed

- Since LargeIconBridge caches values, the cache no longer

serves its original purpose (preventing JNI jumps in cases where

we already knew a favicon is not available). This mechanism is

effectively taken care of by the LargeIconBridge.

3. Backoff to Generated Icons is removed

- The logic permitted requesting generated icons if favicons were

not available. This was effectively used ONLY in

MostVisitedTilesProcessor, where the entire backoff logic could

be replaced by 3 additional lines of code.

4. Favicon callback replaced with generic Callback

- This type will also be used to decode and pass other image data.

5. FaviconFetcher hosts LargeIconBridge

- The intention is for FaviconFetcher to become

SuggestionDecorationFetcher and handle more than just favicons.

- FaviconFetcher dependencies were managed externally, where in

practice these did not have (and should not) be.

entry.title: Android: Fix Robolectric timeout logic
entry.content:
A couple of bugs:

1) An absolute time was being passed to .wait() (takes a relative time)

2) A negative value was possible for a different call to .wait() (caused

an exception for me)



Plus:

a) Scale timeouts by number of tests in a shard

b) Sort timeout dumps by shard ID

c) Refactor shard logic from multiple lists -> list of structs

entry.title: crosier: Add base class InteractiveAshTest for ash-chrome tests
entry.content:
Base class for tests of ash-chrome integration with the ChromeOS

platform, like hardware daemons, graphics, kernel, etc.



Sets up Kombucha for ash testing:

- Provides 1 Kombucha "context" per display, shared by all

views::Widgets

- Provides a default "context widget" so Kombucha can synthesize mouse

events

- Suppresses creating a browser window on startup, because most

ash-chrome tests don't need the window and creating it slows down

the test



Tests using this base class can be added to "chromeos_integration_tests"

to run on devices under test (DUTs) and virtual machines (VMs). Also, if

a test only communicates with OS daemons via D-Bus then the test can

also run in the linux-chromeos "emulator" in "interactive_ui_tests". The

latter approach makes it simpler to write the initial version of a test,

which can then be added to "chromeos_integration_tests" to also run on

DUT/VM.



Because this class derives from InProcessBrowserTest the source files

must be added to a target that defines HAS_OUT_OF_PROC_TEST_RUNNER. The

source files cannot be in a shared test support target that lacks that

define.



Bug: b:291732302

Test: interactive_ui_tests --gtest_filter=InteractiveAshTestUITest.Basics

Test: out_betty/Release/run_chromeos_integration_tests # VM

Test: out_dedede/Release/run_chromeos_integration_tests # DUT

entry.title: Reland "[customize-chrome][cr2023] Establish dependencies of features in code"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit f0db7b86166ef32ecdfbcb2a72e4a0abe6189db8. The

original CL got reverted due to issues with component layering. This CL

defines the dependency in the //ui/base component to work around that.



Original change's description:

> [customize-chrome][cr2023] Establish dependencies of features in code

>

> Chrome Refresh requires the Customize Chrome side panel. This CL ensures

> that Chrome Refresh is only enabled if Customize Chrome is enabled, too.

>

> Additionally, this CL introduces a new feature flag that disables Chrome

> Refresh even if Customize Chrome is enabled. This allows us to set up a

> holdback experiment for the Customize Chrome side panel where both

> experiment arms have Chrome Refresh disabled.

>

> Things to note:

> * Only some Omnibox features need to be gated by Customize Chrome. This

> CL adds a helper to gate those specific call sites. The helper lives

> in //components/omnibox/common to work around cyclic dependency

> issues. This CL modifies DEPS rules accordingly.

> * This CL moves ntp_features into a new GN target so that users can

> depend on it in isolation. This, too, works around cyclic dependency

> issues.

>

entry.title: [Nearby] Add Nearby Presence credential storage class skeletons.
entry.content:
Added two skeleton classes for Nearby Presence credential storage

implementation -- NearbyPresenceCredentialStorage and

CredentialStorage. Added an empty NearbyPresenceCredentialStorage

interface to facilitate communication between the two processes

that the aforementioned classes are hosted in, which will have

methods added to it as each method is implemented.



CredentialStorage is a platform implementation of the Credential

Storage API, used by Nearby Presence to store public and private

credentials. NearbyPresenceCredentialStorage is the browser

implementation of methods involved in storing credentials to a

database. It implements the Mojo interface

NearbyPresenceCredentialStorage, to allow CredentialStorage to

call relevant methods to save and retrieve credentials.



Test: Added stub unit tests

Low-Coverage-Reason: Empty overrides stubs not tested.
